Message:
When I finally met my big sister,
she was different from
what I’d imagined.

Her appearance was
that of a young girl,
with limbs so thin and frail.

Her body looked like it would
fall apart at any moment...

She tilted her head,
eyes remaining expressionless.

Yes, dear sister.
We are but imitations of life
created by those foolish humans.

Since our lives are sure to
end soon, what shall we do
in our last moments?

Why not exact revenge
on humanity? We could
start here, with this land—

Huh...? Go to...school?
A human one? Why?!

To make...memories, you say?
Why should we do something
so human?
